title: US: Envision AESC Targets 70 GWh/Year Of Battery Manufacturing Capacity
notes:
Location:
- Envision AESC is planning a new battery gigafactory in South Carolina, US, close to BMW Group's vehicle production and battery assembly facilities. They also have a facility in Smyrna, Tennessee, US, and are expanding globally with new plants in Japan, the UK, France, Spain, and China.

Capacity:
- The new battery gigafactory in South Carolina is planned to have a capacity of 30 GWh per year. The facility in Kentucky is also expected to have an output of 30 GWh per year, with an option for 40 GWh/year. The existing facility in Smyrna, Tennessee, US, has a capacity of approximately 3.0 GWh per year.

Investment amounts:
- Specific investment amounts are not provided in the articles. However, Envision AESC is rapidly expanding its manufacturing capabilities globally, indicating significant investments in these projects. 

Project progress:
- Envision AESC is currently working to finalize a suitable site for the new battery gigafactory in South Carolina. Further details are expected to be announced once the company secures the plot. The facility in Kentucky was announced in April 2022, and the company is also expanding its manufacturing capabilities in Japan, the UK, France, Spain, and China.

Project type:
- The projects include the construction of new battery gigafactories in various locations, indicating new builds.

Value chain stages:
- The articles do not provide specific information about the value chain stages covered at the facilities. However, Envision AESC's global expansion suggests involvement in multiple stages of the battery manufacturing process, including cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.

title: Envision Group to lead development of battery gigafactory in Extremadura
notes:
Location:
- The Venergy+ project is located in Navalmoral de la Mata, in the province of Cáceres, Extremadura, Spain.

Capacity:
- The planned investment for the battery gigafactory is 900 million euros, with a target of creating employment for around 3,000 people from 2025.
- The on-site solar power plant by Acciona is planned to have a capacity of 30 GW by 2030.

Investment amounts:
- The planned investment for the Venergy+ project is one billion euros.
- The Regional Government of Extremadura has provided 200 hectares of land for the development of the battery gigafactory.

Project progress:
- The Envision Group has applied for funding from the Strategic Projects for Economic Recovery and Transformation for Electric and Connected Vehicles (PERTE VEC).
- The decision to construct the battery gigafactory was made after several months of negotiations with the Spanish Government and with the support of the Regional Government of Extremadura.

Project type:
- The project involves the construction of a new battery gigafactory in Navalmoral de la Mata.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the production of cells, modules, and high-performance battery packs, as well as the integration of these components into different electrical platforms.

R&D collaboration:
- The project encourages collaborative R&D across the entire battery life cycle, from storage to reuse, with a focus on smart charging and closed-loop recycling.

Note: The project aims to generate an integrated ecosystem for promoting electric mobility and will involve the collaboration of twelve partner companies.

title: Envision AESC to Build a Power Battery Factory in Spain with a Planned Capacity of 30GWh
notes:
Location:
- The battery factory project is located in Navalmoral de la Mata, Spain.

Capacity:
- The planned production capacity of the factory is 30GWh, scheduled to be completed and operational by 2025.

Investment amounts:
- The project is supported by the Spanish government's “Strategic Projects for Economic Recovery and Transformation (PERTE-VEC).”
- The company has not disclosed specific investment amounts for the Spain project.

Project progress:
- The project is in the planning stage, with a scheduled completion and operational date of 2025.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, as it is being constructed from scratch.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover multiple value chain stages, including cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.

Additional information:
- Envision AESC has laid out 11 battery production bases in China, Japan, the US, Britain, France, and Spain, with a total production capacity of zero-carbon batteries exceeding 300GWh by 2026.
- The company has also announced strategic cooperation with international car companies such as Renault, Nissan, Daimler, and Honda.

title: China's Envision proposes EV battery giga-factory in Spain
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project, named VENERGY+, is located in the town of Navalmoral de la Mata in the region of Extremadura, Spain.

Capacity:
- The initial capacity of the giga-factory is planned to be 10 GWh, with expectations to increase it to 30 GWh by 2030.

Investment amounts:
- The project has a planned investment of EUR 1 billion (USD 1.07 billion).
- The consortium has applied for funding from the Spanish government's financing instrument, PERTE VEC, aimed at supporting EVs and connected vehicles with EU rescue funds.

Project progress:
- The proposed battery plant could be operational by 2025.
- The consortium has formed partnerships and applied for funding to support the project's development.

Project type:
- The project is a new build giga-factory for manufacturing high-performance battery cells, modules, and packs.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the manufacturing of high-performance battery cells, modules, and packs with extended range and increased density.

title: Spain to support Seat and Envision battery factories
notes:
Location:
- Envision's planned battery cell factory is located in Navalmoral de la Mata, Spain.
- Seat's battery assembly plant is located at its Martorell plant near Barcelona, Spain.
- The Volkswagen (VW) battery factory is located in Sagunt near Valencia, Spain.

Capacity:
- Envision's plant is expected to produce 50 GWh of battery cells per year once completed.

Investment amounts:
- Envision has a grant of 200 million euros and a loan of 100 million euros for its battery cell factory, with a total investment of over 1.3 billion euros.
- Seat is being subsidized with 47 million euros for its battery assembly plant.
- VW announced an investment of 300 million euros for its battery factory, with the Spanish government covering just under one-sixth of the sum.

Project progress:
- Envision's project was announced in July 2022, with a production start target in 2025.
- Seat's battery assembly plant was announced to be built at its Martorell plant near Barcelona, with the cells supplied from the VW battery factory in Sagunt near Valencia, the construction of which started in March.

Project type:
- Envision's project is a new build for a battery cell factory.
- Seat's project is a battery assembly plant at an existing plant.

Value chain stages:
- Envision's plant will cover cell fabrication, as it will produce battery cells.
- Seat's plant will cover module assembly, as it will manufacture ready-to-install battery packs for vehicle production.

title: Renault may get battery cells made in Spain from China’s AESC
notes:
Location:
- Spain, specifically in Navalmoral de la Mata (Cáceres) for the cell factory.

Capacity:
- The planned capacity of the cell factory is up to 50 GWh, with operations set to begin in 2025.

Investment amounts:
- N/A

Project progress:
- Talks are at an advanced stage for the cell factory in Navalmoral de la Mata. AESC has reportedly signed a contract to supply battery cells to the Spanish Mercedes-Benz Vans plant in Vitoria, with plans for the plant to become one of the global production sites for electric vans based on the new VAN.EA platform from 2026. AESC is also conducting negotiations with "several brands" to supply battery cells to other European plants.

Project type:
- New build for the cell factory in Navalmoral de la Mata.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover cell fabrication, where cathode and anode are combined with an electrolyte.

Note: No specific investment amounts were provided in the articles.
